name: Enterprise ATT&CK - Lazarus TTPs
description: TTPs identified as used by the Lazarus group.

techniques.comment: Lazarus group used Data from Information Repositories (T1213) by using credential dumping utility such as Procdump and Microdump to obtain the necessary credentials.
Lazarus group used PowerShell (T1059.001) to download additional malware.
Lazarus group used Peripheral Device Discovery (T1120) by scanning the infected systems to obtain information about the system.
Lazarus group used Scheduled Task (T1053) as a persistence mechanism for the first component.
Lazarus group used System Information Discovery (T1082) to initially fingerprint the infected systems using the Telegram-based C2 channel.
Lazarus group used Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion (T1070.004) to clean traces of its activity by using a BAT script for self-deletion.
NineRAT has the capability to remove all traces of its presence using Removal:T1201.001.
Lazarus APT uses Telegram-based C2 infrastructure. This technique can be categorized as Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocol (T1071.001).
Lazarus APT group uses System Network Connections Discovery (T1049) to scan active network connections.
Lazarus group used Command and Control (T1105) via a BAT script to set up persistence for the first component malware.

As a part of the Initial Access stage, the threat actors used the vulnerability CVE-2021-44228 (log4j/Log4Shell). This action refers to the technique Exploit Public-Facing Application (T1190) within the tactic Initial Access.
